summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence between U.S. Attorney's Office (USAO) personnel discussing defense attorney David Schoen's involvement in Jeffrey Epstein's case. The emails mock Schoen's legal arguments and self-aggrandizing interview, and reference his role as part of Epstein's defense team shortly before Epstein's death.

persons.name: David Schoen
persons.context: Described as the "quarterback" of Jeffrey Epstein's defense team; his legal arguments are mocked by prosecutors, and he gave a self-aggrandizing interview about consulting with Epstein days before Epstein's death.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The defendant in the case; consulted with attorney David Schoen days before his death in August 2019.

connections.description: Schoen was part of Epstein's defense team and consulted with him days before Epstein's death, as referenced in an interview and the email discussion.

events.title: NY Times reports on Epstein's death
events.description: The New York Times publishes an article about Jeffrey Epstein's suicide death, which is referenced in the email chain.

events.title: David Schoen interview published
events.description: David Schoen gives an interview to the Atlanta Jewish Times about consulting with Jeffrey Epstein days before Epstein's death, which is discussed in the emails.

keyFacts: Prosecutors from the U.S. Attorney's Office are privately mocking defense attorney David Schoen's legal arguments in the Epstein case, calling them 'nutty' and 'absurdly self-aggrandizing'.
David Schoen was reportedly the 'quarterback' of Jeffrey Epstein's defense team and consulted with Epstein days before Epstein's death in August 2019.
The email chain reveals internal prosecution perspective on the defense strategy and attorneys involved in the high-profile Epstein case.
